Psychology     Search the site     Toggle Menu      Search                  Psychology      Psychology   Main Menu    People           Faculty    By Program    Administration    Graduate Students    Research Associate    Staff         Academics           Graduate Studies    Undergraduate Studies         Courses           Academic Catalog    Syllabi    Archived Syllabi         Research           Behavioral Neuroscience    Clinical    Cognitive    Community and Prevention Research    Social and Personality         DIVERSITY           Mission Statement    Diversity Advancement Committee    Programs and Initiatives    Faculty Research    Resources         CLINIC    DEPARTMENT           Contact Us    News    Calendar    Human Subjects    Statistics and Methods Clinic    Support    Intranet    Online Teaching Resources          Eyebrow menu    las.uic.edu    +Give    UIC menu    UIC.edu    Campus Map       Search                      Human Subjects      View Menu           Breadcrumbs   Psychology    Department    Human Subjects        Human Subject Research  Research at the University of Illinois at Chicago (UIC) may only be carried out in accord with the highest ethical standards. UIC has pledged that any research involving human subjects that is conducted by, sponsored by, or otherwise involves UIC, will be carried out in accord with Federal Regulations for the Protection of Human Subjects. Therefore, all human subject research in the Department of Psychology has been approved by the appropriate UIC Institutional Review Board (IRB). For more information about research involving human subjects at UIC, please visit UIC's Office for the Protection of Research Subjects (OPRS) .
